remarks: The chain rule for everywhere-differentiable functions.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Aug-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2015.)
statement:
dvcof.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. { RR , CC } ) $.
dvcof.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. { RR , CC } ) $.
dvcof.f $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> CC ) $.
dvcof.g $e |- ( ph -> G : Y --> X ) $.
dvcof.df $e |- ( ph -> dom ( S _D F ) = X ) $.
dvcof.dg $e |- ( ph -> dom ( T _D G ) = Y ) $.
dvcof $p |- ( ph -> ( T _D ( F o. G ) ) = ( ( ( S _D F ) o. G ) oF x. ( T _D G ) ) ) $.
